rows.text: Soils have many types of roles available for animals, fungi (mushrooms), and other microbes to fill, and as a result there are many many types of organisms.
The above animals are only the small number that we are able to see easily, most are invisible animals and microbes.

Only a very small number of the organisms in the soil are harmful pests or diseases. The rest are not harmful and many are quite beneficial, eating pests, transforming organic matter into nutrients for plants, and bringing nitrogen from the air to feed plants
To maintain the beneficial life in the soil, returning organic matter to soils and covering it when possible, are two important principles.
